detailedRequirements:
Overview
- Development of new Case Studies pages for topcoder.com
- We don't know where this page is fitting into the main navigation and site structure yet, so lets not tie it anything (It might end up in it's own new nav section)
- Lets only build the landing page (grid of case studies) and one case study detail to start
- The rest of the case study details will follow the same template, just different content
- We'll need to eventually carry over all of the case studies from: http://crowdsourcing.topcoder.com/projects/
- 28 total case studies
- Trevor may need to create some additional assets, graphics, and/or images for unique case studies. The majority of them should fit into the Details template though
- PSDs are available here: https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/0B6kvOdxpqnKMUDdfWFlGcnJBMVE?usp=sharing

Landing Page
- The "App Design & Development" ad would only appear when the user has filtered by "App Design & Development"
- When "All Case Studies" is selected, no ad is needed, just the grid of case studies
- There should be lazy loading or a "View More" button to load more cse studies if needed
- The entire case study box should be clickable to select/ view a case study
- The "View Details" hover should appear on hover of the case study box (desktop only)

Details Page
- Numbers in left column should count up (similar to the crowdsourcing.topcoder.com site) when the user scrolls into that section
- If multiple images/ portfolio images, these should be contained within a slider/ gallery (NYC Agency: Seen example)
- If there are just single infographic type images, those should just be displayed as is (NASA example)
- The quote text should change depending on the type of case study it is:
-- Blue = App Design & Development (#0a71e6)
-- Orange = Algorithms & Analytics (#fb7d21)
-- Green = App Modernization (#60c700)
-- Red = Innovation Programs (#f22e24)
-- Purple = Staff Augmentation (#9050a3)
-- Light Blue = Community Segments (#25ade9)
- Prev/ Next buttons on the bottom should function like they do on the training.topcoder.com site
finalSubmissionGuidelines:
- Using current topcoder.com development processes that we've been using for the other topcoder.com updates
- We can still use Slack for communications
- Just using Direct/Tasks to better track spending for accounting purposes
